item.title: White House will miss 'fiscal cliff' deadline - The Hill's On The Money

item.content:encoded: White House will miss 'fiscal cliff' deadline, sequester report coming next week http://t.co/2EPap86s The White House said Friday that it will not be able to deliver a report to Congress on the spending cuts in the fiscal cliff on time. item.title: UPDATE: 100,000 People Tell CNN To Fire Contributor For Sexist Comments
item.description: UPDATE: 100,000 People Tell CNN To Fire Contributor For Sexist Comments: Over 100,000 people have signed onto a ... http://t.co/D34PO7q9
item.content:encoded: UPDATE: 100,000 People Tell CNN To Fire Contributor For Sexist Comments: Over 100,000 people have signed onto a ... http://t.co/D34PO7q9 Over 100,000 people have signed onto a petition calling on CNN to fire Erick Erickson, the contributor who dubbed the largely female lineup at the Democratic Convention 'the Vagina Monoglogues.' According to Nita Chaudhary, co-founder of Ultraviolet, which launched the petition, it sailed past 100,000 signatures this morning, and is still steadily growing. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: thinkprogress.org

item.title: Poll Shows Obama Convention Bump
item.description: Already?//Gallup Poll Shows Bump In Approval For Obama After Convention http://t.co/P0Letr2v via @HuffPostPol
item.content:encoded: Already?//Gallup Poll Shows Bump In Approval For Obama After Convention http://t.co/P0Letr2v via @HuffPostPol Those looking for a convention bump may find what they are looking for in the Gallup daily tracking poll, which produced good news on Friday for President Barack Obama. Gallup's last three nights of interviewing of adults, conducted Sept. 4 to 6, shows Obama with a 52 percent approval rating, the highest approval percentage reported for Obama on the Gallup tracking poll since May 2011, just after the killing of Osama bin Laden. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

item.title: An Open Letter to Wikipedia About Anatole Broyard and
item.description: Philip Roth writes an open letter to Wikipedia: http://t.co/l2mD1bRp
item.content:encoded: Philip Roth writes an open letter to Wikipedia: http://t.co/l2mD1bRp I am Philip Roth. I had reason recently to read for the first time the Wikipedia entry discussing my work. The entry contains a serious misstatement that I would like to ask to have removed. This item of my biography entered Wikipedia not from the world of truthfulness but from the babble of literary gossip—there is no truth in it at all., I am Philip Roth. I had reason recently to read for the first time the Wikipedia entry discussing my work. The entry contains a serious misstatement that I would like to ask to have removed. This item of my biography entered Wikipedia not from the world of truthfulness but from the babble of literary gossip—there is no truth in it at all. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: newyorker.com

item.content:encoded: White House circulating draft of executive order on cybersecurity - The Hill (blog) http://t.co/2R7QkxBp The White House is circulating a draft of an executive order aimed at protecting the country from cyber attacks, The Hill has learned. The draft proposal, which has been sent to relevant federal agencies for feedback, is a clear sign that the administration is resolved to take action on cybersecurity even as Congress remains gridlocked on legislation that would address the threat. Link - Trackbacks
